isis.stitle: 7 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER PS110-7, PS145-7 - DISASSEMBLE - CASE AND GEARS

figure.caption: Figure 12. Case and Gears Exploded View

step1.para: Remove the output bearing cap and gasket ( Figure 13).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Remove Output Bearing Cap and Gasket

step1.para: Remove the countershaft bearing caps ( Figure 14).

figure.caption: Figure 14. Remove Countershaft Bearing Caps

step1.para: Insert a bolt into the upper reverse idler shaft and remove ( Figure 15). Don't lose the lockball in the shaft.

figure.caption: Figure 15. Insert Bolt Into Upper Reverse Idler Shaft

step1.para: Roll the upper reverse idler gear toward the side of the case ( Figure 16).

figure.caption: Figure 16. Roll Upper Reverse Idler Gear Toward Side of Case

step1.para: Engage the 1st-reverse collar into 1st gear ( Figure 17).

figure.caption: Figure 17. Engage 1st-Reverse Collar into 1st Gear

step1.para: Remove the input bearing cap, gasket and input shaft ( Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Remove Input Bearing Cap, Gasket and Input Shaft

step1.para: Remove the clutch housing bolts and separate the housing from the case ( Figure 19). Use of a chain hoist is recommended due to the weight of the housing.

figure.caption: Figure 19. Remove Clutch Housing Bolts

step1.para: Remove the snap rings from the countershafts ( Figure 20).

figure.caption: Figure 20. Remove Snap Rings From Countershafts

warning.para: Always wear safety glasses to protect your eyes when removing or installing snap rings or bearings.

step1.para: Remove the countershaft drive gears with the aid of a large puller ( Figure 21).

figure.caption: Figure 21. Remove Countershaft Drive Gears With Puller

step1.para: Remove the countershaft drive gear countershaft keys ( Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Remove Countershaft Drive Gear Countershaft Keys

step1.para: The 6th-7th clutch collar may be removed from the mainshaft ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Remove 6th-7th Clutch Collar

step1.para: Place a sling around the 2nd-3rd mainshaft clutch gear and use a hoist to provide support during bearing removal ( Figure 24). The milled slots help make output bearing removal easier.

figure.caption: Figure 24. Place Sling Around 2nd-3rd Mainshaft Clutch Gear

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft snap ring and the internally splined thrust washer ( Figure 25).

figure.caption: Figure 25. Remove Mainshaft Snap Ring

step1.para: Remove the snap ring and both the externally and the internally splined thrust washers ( Figure 26).

figure.caption: Figure 26. Remove Snap Ring and Thrust Washers

step1.para: Remove the remaining gear bore snap ring ( Figure 27).

figure.caption: Figure 27. Remove Remaining Gear Bore Snap Ring

step1.para: Butt 1st and reverse gears together. Secure them with lockwire to provide the necessary clearance for mainshaft removal ( Figure 28).

figure.caption: Figure 28. Secure 1st and Reverse Gears With Lockwire

step1.para: Use a puller to remove the countershaft front bearings ( Figure 29).

figure.caption: Figure 29. Use Puller to Remove Countershaft Front Bearings

step1.para: Move the countershafts to the rear as far as possible ( Figure 30).

figure.caption: Figure 30. Move Countershafts to Rear

step1.para: Remove countershaft bearings ( Figure 31).

figure.caption: Figure 31. Remove Countershaft Bearings

step1.para: To provide necessary clearance for mainshaft removal, move both countershafts forward and toward the side of the case ( Figure 32). Countershaft alignment blocks, ZTSE-4328, can also be used to help restrain the countershafts. Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS.

figure.caption: Figure 32. Move Both Countershafts Forward

step1.para: Lift the mainshaft assembly out of the case ( Figure 33). Use a chain hoist for this procedure due to the weight of the assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 33. Lift Mainshaft Assembly Out of Case

step1.para: Remove the upper reverse idler gear ( Figure 34).

figure.caption: Figure 34. Remove Upper Reverse Idler Gear

step1.para: Remove the lower reverse idler shaft and idler gear ( Figure 35).

figure.caption: Figure 35. Remove Lower Reverse Idler Shaft and Idler Gear

step1.para: Because of this upper idler boss interference, it is easier to remove the right side countershaft first. Then remove the left side countershaft ( Figure 36).

figure.caption: Figure 36. Remove Right Side Countershaft First

step1.para: Check both idler gears and bearings for excessive wear ( Figure 37). Replace if necessary.

figure.caption: Figure 37. Inspect Idler Gears and Bearings
